data: ANES Pre Operative for Diabetic Patients (Module)
Patient Care
POC Glucose Whole Blood
q4h, and on arrival to Perioperative Care Centre (PCC)
Notify Treating Provider
When glucose below 4 mmol/L or above 14 mmol/L
Continuous Infusions
For diabetic patients NOT on insulin
plasmalyte continuous infusion
order rate: 100 mL/h, IV, drug form: bag
For diabetic patients on insulin
dextrose 5%-sodium chloride 0.45% (D5-1/2NS) continuous infusion
order rate: 75 mL/h, IV, drug form: bag
Medications
BASAL insulin (longer acting)
Typical total daily starting dose of basal insulin is no greater than 10 units in a de novo patient
Select even if NPO or unable to eat. Prescriber may reduce dose by 25% if NPO or poor intake
Select insulin NPH OR insulin glargine OR insulin determir OR insulin degludec
Prescriber may order insulin NPH at 50% of the normal morning dose if morning dose of pre-mixed insulin is held
insulin isophane (NPH)
unit, subcutaneous, qdaily with breakfast, drug form: inj
OR
Prescriber may order insulin glargine, insulin detemir  or insulin deludec at 80% of the normal morning dose
insulin glargine (BASAGLAR)
unit, subcutaneous, qdaily with breakfast, drug form: pen
ONLY SELECT insulin glargine (LANTUS) if patient on medication prior to admission or coverage is confirmed
insulin glargine (LANTUS)
unit, subcutaneous, qdaily with breakfast, drug form: inj
insulin detemir
unit, subcutaneous, qdaily before food, drug form: inj
insulin degludec
unit, subcutaneous, qdaily with breakfast, drug form: inj
CORRECTION SCALE (shorter acting)
Select for ALL patients, even if NPO or not eating
Select in addition to NUTRITIONAL insulin
LOW - CORRECTION SCALE (shorter acting)
For total daily insulin requirements less than 40 units/day from all sources  Select same type of insulin as NUTRITIONAL insulin
insulin regular - correction scale
Sliding scale, subcutaneous, TID before food, drug form: inj
MEDIUM - CORRECTION SCALE (shorter acting)
For total daily insulin requirements 40 to 99 units/day from all sources   Select same type of insulin as NUTRITIONAL insulin
insulin regular - correction scale
Sliding scale, subcutaneous, TID before food, drug form: inj
HIGH - CORRECTION SCALE (shorter acting)
For total daily insulin requirements 100 units/day or more from all sources   Select same type of insulin as NUTRITIONAL insulin
insulin regular - correction scale
Sliding scale, subcutaneous, TID before food, drug form: inj
BASAL insulin (longer acting)
Typical total daily starting dose of basal insulin is no greater than 10 units in a de novo patient
Select even if NPO or unable to eat. Prescriber may reduce dose by 25% if NPO or poor intake
insulin isophane (NPH)
unit, subcutaneous, qdaily with breakfast, drug form: inj
insulin isophane (NPH)
unit, subcutaneous, qdaily with supper, drug form: inj

unit, subcutaneous, qHS, drug form: inj
